title: Garth Crooks pays Arsenal back-handed compliment as he tries to praise David Luiz
text:

Former Tottenham forward Garth Crooks praised Arsenal defender David Luiz but expressed his incredulity at the Brazilian's side's position in the table following their 1-0 win over Bournemouth .

Luiz scored the Gunners' only goal of the game and helped them keep a clean sheet to record a result which saw them move up to third place in the Premier League.

Arsenal have attracted their fair share of critics this season, particularly after their dire 1-1 draw with Manchester United , but Crooks was quick to laud Luiz following his performance against the Cherries.

Naming Luiz in his team of the week on BBC Sport Crooks said: "Just when Spurs fans think the week cannot get any worse, Arsenal win at home to Bournemouth and the victory takes them up to third in the table.

(Image: REUTERS)

"Luiz, who never does things the easy way, scored his first goal for the Gunners and the only goal of the game but more importantly kept his first clean sheet in an Arsenal shirt."

As an ex-Spurs player Crooks couldn't resist having a cheeky dig at Arsenal, however, and said he was amazed the Gunners were so far up the league considering their often far from convincing displays at the back.

"I cannot believe this Arsenal team are third in the table," Crooks added. "I know we are only eight games into the Premier League season but their defence has been so bad, how is this possible?"

(Image: Getty Images)

Arsenal will hope to maintain their place in the top four when they travel to Sheffield United after the international break on October 20.

Manager Unai Emery will be hoping the break will allow the likes of Kieran Tierney, Rob Holding and Hector Bellerin the time to fully recover, and the trio could be available for selection having featured in the Carabao Cup and Europa League recently.
description: The BBC pundit named Luiz in his team of the week and begrudgingly praised the maverick centre-back
